speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Magnus Burnsides
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Taako Taaco
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously, on The Adventure Zone…

speaker: Merle
lines: Uh oh…

speaker: Taako
lines: What happened to Robbie?

speaker: The Director
lines: Robbie has been thrown into the brig. We-we’re gonna be keeping an eye on him, for-for a while.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Pringles?

speaker: Taako
lines: Does he love Pringles too much?

speaker: Kravitz
lines: Was this call for business or pleasure?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, I mean a little bit of both! I, for sure didn’t wanna be dragged to hell or whatever it is you do.

speaker: Angus
lines: Sir, I know it’s none of my business, but I’m-I’m curious why… you haven’t told anybody about... about your kids.

speaker: Merle
lines: I wa-was a really...crappy dad, and I was an even crappier husband.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see yourself wearing a red robe, but there’s an—umm—um like, a next logical thought that would come from that observation, but when you try to think it, your mind just turns to static. It’s just tearing you apart and keeping you up at night.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the Void Fish slams against the wall of its tank, and it’s kinda-it’s kinda scary.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You had a baby? You had an egg.

speaker: Griffin
lines: A quick, bright light flashes, and a small, quiet alarm bell rings.

speaker: Announcer
lines: Mmm, what a devilish twist! What other mysteries await us down the winding path toward… The Adventure Zone!

speaker: [THEME MUSIC
lines: "Déjà Vu" by Mort Garson (full song on YouTube)]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let it begin...let the-

speaker: Taako
lines: What?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let it—let it start, it is started.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, can I just, wait can I just, before we start-start-start, I wanna just say—

speaker: Griffin
lines: mmmMMM it has started! [crosstalk]

speaker: Travis
lines: But, just I went back and, can I just say, goin’ back and listening to old episodes, I was listenin’ to the last Lunar Interlude, before we did The Eleventh Hour, I had a lot of cool items I forgot to use during The Eleventh Hour! [laughing from him and Clint]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, everybody had lots of cool items that they forgot to use! I was really hopin’ for that Immovable Rod you have, Taako, to pop up during that purple worm chase, that would have been neat, but—

speaker: Travis
lines: I had a magnetic, uh… [crosstalk] sphere, I’m just saying, it’s a lot of stuff.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Don’t fucking kibbitz, don’t like…

speaker: Clint
lines: [crosstalk] *laughs* Back-backseat dungeoneer!

speaker: Justin
lines: Especially like Taako, Taako uses more of his garbage than anybody.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s a good point, I shouldn’t- I shouldn’t harp on Justin, alright let’s...

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh, yeah, but you did unhaul a lot of stuff that you hadn’t mentioned for a long time, when you were talking to Kravitz.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Everyone lived, we’re good. Uhhh, we’ll see if you fare as well in this next arc. Which- [Garfield the Deals Warlock voice] which has begun!

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Ah, dammit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, so things have been quiet—

speaker: Clint
lines: Now it’s begun?

speaker: Travis
lines: Are you sure? Now is this it—

speaker: Griffin
lines: It started when I said, ‘Things have been quiet’, that was the start of it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well actually Griffin’s an hour behind, he’s on Central time, so actually it hasn’t started — or maybe it started for us an hour ago—

speaker: Griffin
lines: It begun an hour ago and you didn’t even realise it.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Ah, shit.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] I’ll catch you up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hey! Lemme start weaving the story?

speaker: Clint
lines: Weave! Weave away, weavemaster!

speaker: Griffin
lines: So. Things have been quiet at the Bureau of Balance since the conclusion of your last adventure, uhm, which was probably a couple of months ago, because it is midsummer and it’s actually a—a couple of days from the Midsummer Harvest Festival, which was, if you’ll remember, that sick carnival you went to in that—that uh, first, uh, lunar interlude—

speaker: Travis
lines: Where we saw the eyes in the skies…?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah! It’s been almost a year since then. Uhm, and uh so—so the Midsummer Harvest Festival is two days away but there’s actually — weirdly enough, there’s no trappings of that festival going up. Like, last year round this time there were Bureau employees coming and going, and putting up tents, and erecting booths, and preparing decorations, and setting up little game tents, but today just two days out preparation efforts have been… meager at best.

speaker: Justin
lines: Budget cutbacks?

speaker: Clint
lines: Cutbacks!

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh no, wait were we supposed to do it—?! Oh shit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well the three of you haven’t been- Haven’t been helping out that much because the Director has had the three of you doing really intensive training. Like… 8 hours a day every day—

speaker: Clint
lines: Boooo—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, like physical training, or just like corporate training?

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughter]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, physical training, a lot of it taking place in that dojo that the regulators have set up. You’ve been working with Carey and Killian and Noelle and some of the other regulators to just like, get better? And, uh, I think that’s the justification for you all jumping up to level 12 in your training. And she’s been preparing you rigorously for your next mission, the particulars of which she hasn't shared. She’s just kinda leaned on you in your training and, at this point, I mean it’s been a little over a year now, you have like a pretty deep… personal, like relationship, even like friendship, with the Director... but in the past month she’s been… kinda cold… to you… She’s been more—

speaker: Travis
lines: Like, temperature-wise or—?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like, um, relationship-wise — she’s been really reserved—

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Oh no!

speaker: Griffin
lines: During training the friendship that you’ve—, the friendliness that you’ve seen from her, it just isn’t there. She’s extremely critical when you’re in training and uh, she also seems extremely worried. And this morning while you’re on your way to one of these intensive training sessions, you receive a message from the Director it’s time for your next mission to begin and she wants to see you in her office.

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh-ohhhhh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as you enter, she is sitting there, with uh, one hand on her staff, and her- her face in her other hand, and she looks up as you enter her office and she says, uh

speaker: Director
lines: Come in. H-How are uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: I want you to know, Griffin, I really misunderstood what you just said, and I thought she was holding her staff in one hand and her face in the other—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [sarcastically] Yes, she took her face- slash- off—

speaker: Clint
lines: Oooh! Westworld!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, she was, uh, no, she was just, she looks tired, man. And as you come in she says,

speaker: Director
lines: How are you boys, how are you boys feeling today?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uhh,

speaker: Merle
lines: Meh.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Fine, I mean I drank my protein, my pre-workout protein shake and now it’s for NOTHING I’ve got a lot of built up protein energy now—

speaker: Director
lines: Whey protein or beef?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Both.

speaker: Director
lines: That is a lot.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I call it wheef.

speaker: Merle
lines: [not in proper character voice] Uh I’ve been, uh binging, uh

speaker: Justin
lines: Who is this?

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh, I’ve been binging Orange Is The—

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s right there, your character. Sounds like Dad!

speaker: Merle
lines: Uh, I’ve been, uh, binging... Orange Is The New Black.

speaker: Director
lines: Oh! How is it this season? I feel like it got lost in the weeds a bit?

speaker: Merle
lines: Nyeh, maybe a few too many characters but, uh, y’know, all in all, not bad.

speaker: Director
lines: Taako, are you well?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, I’m fine! You’re not my mom!

speaker: Merle
lines: She keeps calling us boys!

speaker: Taako
lines: I can’t tell you everything in my life, I’m fine! What do you want?

speaker: Director
lines: I’m… I wanna apologise—

speaker: Taako
lines: I—I’m very busy! I will say that!

speaker: Merle
lines: We’ve been dojo-ing the hell outta this place!

speaker: Director
lines: I, I know and I’m… I’m sorry for leaning on you as hard as I have been lately, I just... [beat] I know what’s waiting for you on your next mission and I just want you to be at peak performance.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Is it one of those things where it’s like either super bad or super good?

speaker: Merle
lines: [in a lower voice] It ain’t super good.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well you don’t know! Shut up!

speaker: Director
lines: No, Merle’s right.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Damn.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She reaches into a drawer in her desk, and she pulls out a blue envelope with a fairly ornate gold trim, and she says,

speaker: Director
lines: It’s time I tell you boys a story I haven’t told you before Before you enlisted in the Bureau Of Balance, before the Bureau was even formed, I foolishly aspired to recover and destroy the Grand Relics on my own.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Ooohh.

speaker: Director
lines: I searched for months to locate these relics, but I came up empty. And that’s when I received this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she holds up that envelope, and uh, uh, opens it up and inside, she pulls out a flyer. Uhm, and it’s really gaudy. It’s really colourful, and it is advertising in big, colourful block letters, a place called ‘Wonderland’.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oooh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, uh, behind that word ‘Wonderland’ is a colourful map showing a large circular clearing in a forest called the Felicity Wilds, and on the reverse side of this flyer is a picture of a small copper bell. And it is inlaid with a diamond pattern across its body and in a bunch of different fonts, actually, all equally gaudy and ugly, this side with the bell on it reads ‘The Grand Relic you’ve been looking for! The Animus Bell!’ And she hands that flyer to you all to inspect. She says

speaker: The Director
lines: On this flyer is an image, and it is, in fact, a grand relic. As the flyer says, it’s the Animus Bell. When I was doing my investigations, I learned its name, but not its capabilities or whereabouts, but here it was, on paper, with a map included.

speaker: Taako
lines: This feels trap-like, right?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, a little on the nose, isn’t it?

speaker: The Director
lines: I mean, I of course researched Wonderland before I made my attempt on it. It is a place where for those lucky enough to be invited or to otherwise be lured into its walls, it promised the fulfilment of any material wish, the rewarding of any prize that its visitors sought out - hence my personalised flyer here. It is of course a death trap, [Magnus Uh-huh.] but it was not without its fair share of victors. I heard stories, mostly secondhand, of survivors who made their way out of Wonderland claiming to have found the prizes that they sought within. But their accounts of what is inside Wonderland never matched up, meaning that the contents are somehow different for each person who enters it. One person told of a maze full of undead killers, another told of a tomb of horrors. I was… I was overly ambitious.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She turns her b— she’s in like a rotating office chair—she sorta turns her back on you and she says

speaker: The Director
lines: My journey through Wonderland was hell, boys. I faced foes the likes of which I’ve never seen outside of those walls, and psychological terrors that to this day leave me shaken. I abandoned my delve into Wonderland, but only after losing a wager that cost me dearly.

speaker: Griffin
lines: With her back to you, she is facing that portrait in the back of the room, the one that I guess— I think it was Taako who thought it had some kind of arcane energy around it, and with a wave of her white oak staff, that image in the portrait changes, and the Lucretia that you see - she’s about a 50 year old woman - disappears, and there is a young woman, in the portrait, with the same light hair and dark skin that the Director has, but she looks a couple of decades younger than the Director that you know today. And the Director rotates her chair to face you and says

speaker: The Director
lines: That was me, not that long ago. I wagered 20 years of my life in a game of chess in Wonderland... and I lost. I’m not a vain woman. I don’t care about losing the beauty of my youth, but 20 years is lot of life to have pulled out from under you.

speaker: Taako
lines: Why’d you wager that much? Seems like a lot.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah.

speaker: The Director
lines: It was what was necessary to progress through Wonderland. I’ve known about this place since before you joined the organisation, but to tell you the truth I am terrified of it. ‘Cause if I lose you boys in Wonderland, we lose everything. But I think the time has come. I... I know that you’re ready.

speaker: Travis
lines: I - okay, this is Travis OOC here. I’m having this moment that I have every time that I watch any kind of like... like, movie or TV show and like things have happened that some characters know about that others characters don’t, where I’m just like screaming at them like, ‘Just tell them! Just be open in communication and everybody tell everybody exactly what happened!’ and I’m sitting here, like, as Travis wanting to tell the Director everything that we know, but at the same time, just not knowing if I can trust her. I just wanted to share that moment with the audience and with you guys that I have no idea... what to do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah so Magnus is remaining tight-lipped about what he saw on that piece of paper?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah but it’s fuckin hard to do that! Cause like...

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus is pretty, like, forthright and I don’t even know if I‘ve told Taako and Merle about it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah I think that’s an important point, I think we need to establish Have we shared our stories with each other or not?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, well, I mean there was a difference between what you guys did on your most recent lunar interludes, you can talk about that whether or not you want. I actually don’t know if all of you listened to that Lunar Interlude, so this may not even be a dramatic irony situation, you may literally not know what happened in the other boys’ stories. So that’s up to you, and we can establish that before we go forward what have you told each other?

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, now that I think about it... I really impressed upon... dorkboy not to say anything to anybody, so I guess I still wanna to keep Moxie and Mavis a secret so.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Not their names but—

speaker: Clint
lines: Merle wouldn’t have shared that, then.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: I would say that… [sigh] I don’t know! Has Magnus told them about the Voidfish conversation? I’m gonna say no, because I feel like him being a Red Robe because— or in a picture not understanding it, he’s probably a little bit nervous to tell Taako and Merle about it because he doesn’t want to incriminate himself.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure! Yeah. Uh, Taako, did you tell everybody about your hot date?

speaker: Justin
lines: Uhh, no, probably not. Like, I think that—

speaker: Justin
lines: Not for any other reason than, like, Taako doesn’t seem somebody who shares a lot of that stuff necessarily anyway. Like I don’t think… Just because like Taako went on a date like [snorts with laughter] Taako went on a date with Death and that sounds like so cool—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Justin
lines: Actually, now that I say it out loud—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Justin
lines: He may not be able to resist! [cackling laughter] But I just don’t think—

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is also worth keeping in mind Kravitz tried to kill Merle for… a while there and it’s probably, is definitely responsible for what happened to his hand. I guess Magnus shares responsibility in that.

speaker: Justin
lines: I just don’t want, I don’t want anybody to misconstrue it as Taako being like, cautious about talking about his sexuality. It’s literally just he doesn’t think it’s anybody’s fuckin’ business, especially not these three fuckin’ clowns—

speaker: Justin
lines: —That have fixed onto him, barnacle-like, as he tries to save the earth.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, okay, that’s good to know, let’s hop back into this scene, then. The Director is like, warning you, she says

speaker: The Director
lines: Wonderland will try to break you. You will face dangers the likes of which you’ve never seen. You will face mental and emotional torment. But if you stay together, and you trust each other, you can keep yourself from losing yourself in there.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Listen, I know that you went through some real hell in there, and it sounds like you had a really rough time. This. Sounds. Awesome.

speaker: Taako
lines: [quietly, slightly over Magnus] It does sound awesome!

speaker: Magnus
lines: I cannot wait to get in there and—

speaker: Merle
lines: On the other hand! [nervous laugh] Sounds a little dangerous!

speaker: Magnus
lines: No but like, there are challenges —

speaker: Merle
lines: I bet Killian would — Killian could knock the shit out of this job, I bet!

speaker: The Director
lines: Killian - the, the Grand Relic, the Animus Bell, is still in Wonderland somewhere. I cannot trust Killian to go in and recover it without taking it for herself.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [gasp] Gotcha gotcha gotcha! Is there some like buddy, some kind of person or thing that’s like, in charge of Wonderland that we’re gonna get to fight, like another big battle kinda thing?

speaker: The Director
lines: I only—

speaker: Magnus
lines: I just, it’s been a really long time and we didn’t really get to have like a biiiiig fight in the ‘Eleventh Hour’.

speaker: The Director
lines: Oh, you will have good fights in there, I guarantee it. I - I only heard voices. There were… there were voices that would give me directions—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool.

speaker: The Director
lines: —but I never saw anybody in Wonderland. There were, I believe other participants in Wonderland while I was going through it, but I never saw them either.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool!

speaker: The Director
lines: I’m less worried about the fights that you will, and more worried about your emotional state being compromised while you’re in there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then you hear a voice, from like immediately from like behind her chair, and I guess Angus has been hiding back there like the whole time and he says

speaker: Angus
lines: Don’t worry, sirs! I’ll be on the radio the whole time and I can help you monitor your emotional state and help keep you calm while you’re in there! So don’t worry about a thing! You’re gonna be cool as cucumbers when you go through Wonderland and the tortures inside!

speaker: Magnus
lines: [feigning aloofness] And you are…?

speaker: Angus
lines: I’m Angus McDonald, boy detective and your very good friend!

speaker: Magnus
lines: [feigning uncertainty] Mm, it sounds familiar…

speaker: Clint
lines: Shouldn’t there be some kind of little musical sting there, when he says that, y’know, like Leave it to Beaver theme or, something...?

speaker: Angus
lines: Nope!

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay!

speaker: Travis
lines: I tousle Ango’s hair and I go

speaker: Magnus
lines: Of course I remember Ango.

speaker: Taako
lines: Lemme see what you got, kid! How’s it comin’? Let’s see it!

speaker: Angus
lines: Oh yeah, of course, sir!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He casts Prestidigitation. And a uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: He casts a fucking level 0 cantrip?! How long has it been?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay he casts—

speaker: Justin
lines: This is the smartest kid on earth and he casts a cantrip?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He casts a level 1 spell, he casts Disguise Self on himself and he looks like you as a little boy — er well he doesn’t know what you look like as a little boy, he just looks like a smaller Taako, and he says,

speaker: Angus
lines: [in a caricatured version of Taako’s voice] What do you think, sir??

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin! Griffin! A taquito?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Angus
lines: [in a Taako impression] What do you think, sir? How am I doooooing?

speaker: Taako
lines: [unimpressed, holding back giggles] You’re still Angus, I wasn’t fooled for a second.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He transforms back into Angus.

speaker: Angus
lines: Oh- oh -o-kay, I’ll keep it up...

speaker: Taako
lines: Very - uh very good though! You’re coming along nicely!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The Director says uh,

speaker: The Director
lines: Are you boys ready to go, or do you have any more business before you blast off?

speaker: Merle
lines: Wait we’re just, like, jumping right in?

speaker: The Director
lines: Would you rather spend like 20 minutes buying shorts again or?

speaker: Merle
lines: I really like those shorts…

speaker: Magnus
lines: So — They were great shorts. You can’t tell us anything about the bell? You don’t know what it does, or… what its deal is?

speaker: The Director
lines: Uhm, no, it was — when these grand relics were sort of circulating throughout the general population there were no accounts of the Animus Bell being used for any dark purposes. Whoever had it squirreled it away nicely and it never really circulated so we don’t have much information on the Animus Bell.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I… I need to ask… I’ve been thinking about it, it’s been a while since I’ve been able to talk to you. I feel like if there are other participants in the maze we run the risk of running into more Red Robes.

speaker: The Director
lines: I find that unlikely. The Red Robes obviously, to my surprise, are still in operation, but there cannot be that many of them.

speaker: Magnus
lines: But if we do run into one, what, is there anything the Bureau knows about them? Anything you can tell us?

speaker: The Director
lines: They are extremely dangerous. They cannot be trusted. If you see one, report it to me over your Stone of Far Speech immediately. And just run away, you are not ready. Don’t listen to a word they say, they will lie to you to get you to do whatever they want, but their purposes are evil, Magnus, they are- they are beings of pure, concentrated evil.

speaker: Magnus
lines: But how do you know?

speaker: The Director
lines: I - I’ve had my fair share of run-ins with the Red Robes.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And they’ve all been evil?

speaker: The Director
lines: Invariably. Any other questions?

speaker: [snorting and giggles from Justin/Taako and Clint/Merle]
Taako
lines: I’ve got a quick errand to run before I can leave.

speaker: The Director
lines: Okay, let’s- let’s get those going, then.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh wait! I do have a question!

speaker: The Director
lines: [sounding maybe a little annoyed] Okay pop it off, Magnus.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What’s the, why isn’t there a festival in prep?

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah!

speaker: The Director
lines: [exasperated sigh] It would be a smaller—

speaker: Magnus
lines: I was looking forward to having some fried unicorn dick!

speaker: The Director
lines: It will be a smaller — yuck — it’ll be a smaller affair this year, I’m sorry boys, but there are slightly more pressing matters at hand.

speaker: Taako
lines: [quietly, almost under his breath] Okay. I thought there’d be a better explanation…

speaker: Magnus
lines: Balls.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah. [laughter]

speaker: Taako
lines: It was a little underwhelming. There just aren’t. Got it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. I jog back — Taako jogs back to his room and he gets underneath his bed and he moves some laundry aside, annnnd he moves the half-eaten Reese’s Piec- Cup he left annnd—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait he couldn’t finish a whole Reese's Cup?!

speaker: Justin
lines: No, he’s watching his figure, and underneath that, oh! There it is! He picks up the Flaming Raging Poisoning Sword of Doom.

speaker: Justin
lines: [half-laughing as he speaks] He-he gets and grabs a washcloth real quick and wipes off some of the dust, and then he puts it on his back.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! Uh, are you guys ready to go?

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, is there any chance that Magnus could find where Pringles has been locked up?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ooooh shit! Uhh.... I mean he’s in uh, I mean there is… a … a… not a prison, what’s the word for like a military like…?

speaker: Travis
lines: Brig?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, he’s in the brig. And he’s been locked up there for a long time. And I think you’ve probably have tried to like go visit him once if only to like, maybe you wanted like a dank potion recipe or something like that? But the brig is like heavy lockdown, Director’s access only or with express permission, and you have not secured that, so you have not been able to visit Pringles. He is on full-blown lockdown.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’d ask for permission.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, can we ask the Director for permission?

speaker: Clint
lines: We’re being sent into hell! We probably won’t come back— [gasp of realisation]

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’d like to say goodbye to my Pringles, please.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says uh,

speaker: The Director
lines: I’m sorry, no. Pringles is… Pringles is dangerous, he is affiliated with the Red Robes. He cannot be trusted. There is no time also, we really need to get this Wonderland mission going. So, I’m sorry but no.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You got it. Okay I just need to go grab something from my room.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: I 100% wanna break into the brig.

speaker: [“Doing Some Crime” starts playing in the background]
Griffin
lines: Fuck! Okay! [pause] Do you tell the other boys what you’re doing?

speaker: Travis
lines: No.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! There are — the brig is in a — we’re gonna take a quick offshoot then! — There’s a dome, probably opposite the dome that the Director’s office and like big kinda throne room-area is in. It is a fairly small dome and when you go inside there is an elevator shaft going down, it’s kinda reminiscent of the dome that the Voidfish is in, because there’s just a single small elevator shaft in the middle and it is guarded by two guards and they say,

speaker: Guards
lines: Stop right there! What are you doing here?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh, I have permission from the Director to come, I just need to talk to the prisoner for one moment.

speaker: Guards
lines: Uh, we don’t accept verbal permission or written permission, she needs to be here in person in order for you to get a trip down to visit our prisoner.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh yes of course, just one sec—

speaker: Travis
lines: And I attack them.

lines: Fuck! Okay!

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m attempting to attack them non-fatally.

lines: Okay how about instead of... doing a full fight here ‘cause I think it’ll take a while and it’ll be something the other 2 boys don’t get to be part of, let’s— I mean, let’s roll a strength contest—

speaker: Travis
lines: [overlapping] Okay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Two different ones but I’m gonna warn ya, Trav, if this goes bad, it’s gonna go fuckin’ bad.

speaker: Travis
lines: I gotcha!

lines: No! I mean, Travis— it sounds like you were going to get your sword and Merle was gonna do something else, it’s up to you, I mean you can tell me now, in fiction if you can justify it would you have any reason to follow Magnus around as you guys do your last prep before you go on this mission?

lines: Merle was just gonna go clear his browsing data. So, no.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. [snickering] Gross.

lines: Gross.

speaker: Travis
lines: So I rolled— I rolled—

speaker: Justin
lines: Uhm.

lines: I mean, I think it would help if he had magic-users with him, but oh! you go ahead and do what you think!

lines: No! I’m not gonna make a run at the Bureau of Balance! You’re asking a character—

lines: No! I’m just saying he’d be better off with us! He’s not gonna do this without us—

lines: He didn’t ask for help!

lines: I know!

lines: He didn’t even consult us!

speaker: Clint
lines: Fine—

speaker: Justin
lines: This should be a group decision!

speaker: Clint

speaker: Justin

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Travis
lines: Um, so with my bonuses and everything I ended up with a, uh, with a 19 and a 20.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, I rolled a 15 on the first one [sound of dice rolling] and a 2 on the second one. All right! Uh yeah, let’s just say you subdue them using like the butt of the Chance Lance, so no stabbing was involved but you knock these two guys out cold—

speaker: Travis
lines: I put ‘em in the pocket workshop.

lines: … Okay … Yeah, alright, we’re gonna have to come up with names for these boys earlier—later, because now you have... captives?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Now, you just have Pokemon’d these two boys [laughter from the others] so I guess later we’re gonna figure out who these boys are because now they live... in your pocket. I’m gonna say the pocket workshop can only sustain 2 boys at once though, [Travis giggles] because I don’t want you to have an infinite bag of boys—

speaker: Travis
lines: —Fair enough!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —That you can just put boys inside. But these 2 boys you do have inside, and you just have them now. Okay so now you’ve got these 2 boys, and the elevator’s unguarded. Uh, you go down the elevator’s basically identical to the Voidfish one and when you go down, there is just a small brig, there are 6 cells in here but only one of them is occupied by your old friend Robbie aka Pringles, who runs up to the cell when you walk in and he says — oh fuck, what did he even sound like??? What - wh - I wasn’t expecting Pringleplay!

speaker: Clint
lines: [in a slow, surfer dude laid-back drawl] Wasn’t he kinda like a laid back, almost like a Shaggy kinda guy?

speaker: Griffin
lines: If not, then the months he spent in prison have turned him into that. He’s like,

speaker: Pringles
lines: [in a surfer-dude drawl] Magnus, is that chu? Aw, shit I didn’t think I’d ever see you again, dude! Didju bring me mah stuff? My Pringies? You know how much I need those... To live!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Pringles, I can’t be here very long. Why are you in here?

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughing] I have two boys in my workshop!

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’ve got two boys in my workshop!

speaker: Pringles
lines: Why am I in the brig, they didn’t tell you?

speaker: Magnus
lines: No!

speaker: Pringles
lines: It was like treason, I guess, dude. I’ll be honest, the Director didn’t believe me, nobody believes me, but like, somebody had me go all through the Bureau of Balance, y’know even the places I wasn’t authorised to be, and then I just kinda woke up and I was in a place I wasn’t supposed to be, and then the Director arrested me, uhm, summarily, and I’ve been down here ever since.

speaker: Magnus
lines: What was the place that you woke up in?

speaker: Pringles
lines: It was a dark room and I was right by this big heavy vault door and uhm.. I just.. I know I was... in the Director’s personal space and there was some of her stuff back there, uhm, and yeah, that’s, that’s where they found me, man. Hey, can you, can you break me outta here?

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, I can’t. I’m sorry.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I mean maybe I can physically, but the question of can I and may I; I may not—

speaker: Pringles
lines: Can you do me a bigger favour?

speaker: Magnus
lines: What’s that?

speaker: Pringles
lines: Can you get me those sweet crisps I crave so much?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I, I will get you, I promise, I’ll stop at the fantasy Go-Mart and get you some on my way back.

speaker: Pringles
lines: My body has a deficiency that—

speaker: Magnus
lines: You need vitamin Pringles, I got it. [Clint cackles] Can you tell me anything you remember from before your body was taken over and you moved without your control?

speaker: Pringles
lines: I was in our bunk, you remember?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yes.

speaker: Pringles
lines: You remember the good times?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I do. Focus up, please!

speaker: Pringles
lines: We played Cornhole?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I kno– yes I remember the Cornhole. I’ve only got like 3 minutes.

speaker: Pringles
lines: I was just in our bunk, and you guys were out on a mission, n’ I was real lonely, and then, my vision just kinda went red, and then the next thing I know I woke up.

speaker: Magnus
lines: And that’s it?

speaker: Pringles
lines: That’s it! I hadn’t had any Pringles that day so I thought I was in maybe some sorta fugue state.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay. Um, if anybody asks, I most definitely totally wasn’t here.

speaker: Pringles
lines: Okay, what happened to those guards upstairs?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh they’re still up there, totally fine, don’t even worry about it. Gotta go!

speaker: Pringles
lines: Oh! Okay! [awkward pause] I miss— I miss us!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Uh, yup!

speaker: Travis
lines: And I get in the elevator.

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s going to be consequences to what happened. Um, at some point, I think? Unless you can figure a way out of it, but if you guys are ready to go, then I guess it’s time to go. Magnus, are you freeing your two Pokémon that you’ve got?

lines: Taako or Merle, do either one of you have any — just, uh, outta curiosity — any kind of like... mind-erasing magic…?

lines: You could give him the same mind erasure tonic we gave uh, Jerry and some of those goblins workin’ on the car. Remember that? Remember that special brew?

lines: Mm, no, what?

lines: That special tonic we gave ‘em where we killed ‘em! The end.

lines: Uh, that’s true…

lines: Ooh kill ‘em!

lines: No, noooo, probably not…

lines: [gasps with an idea] Or maybe you hit ‘em so hard- if you hit them- they have amnesia!

lines: Did I, Griffin?

lines: Oh, no! Uh, you are — Avi walks into the hangar and you realise maybe this conversation should wait. Uh and he says uh,

lines: Good!

lines: Okay!

lines: Uh, yeah this is not your first blast-off. Okay you all load up into the ball, Avi seals it up, and it drops down into the cannon chamber and you hear him count down, and you rest your heads against the back of your seats and prepare for launch!

lines: And as you fly out of the cannon, you go on not a long trip, but along the way you see some familiar sights you coast over the black glass circle that used to be Phandalin, and actually over the road from Neverwinter to Phandalin where your very first journey began — the Bureau is almost right over that area. And just past that road, there is a vast expanse of pine trees, and as soon as you start sailing over them, your sphere begins to decline pretty quickly. You are dropping pretty fast into this ocean of trees.

lines: [overlapping] I pull the brake.

lines: Okay, you pull the brakes and very soon your sphere uh starts to slow waaay down and it’s...it’s lowering very very slowly, almost like an airplane coming in for landing, and it’s being brushed by the high boughs of these pine trees. speaker: Your, your ball took a tumble and has gotten sort of stuck up in a thick bundle of branches in the boughs of these trees, and you are about 40 feet up, and the hatch is actually facing downwards when it opens up, although you’re strapped in so it’s not like you have fallen out. But you are kind of in a precarious position of being in this glass ball about 40 feet up, and the sphere that you came down in is sorta suspended in these boughs, and uh, yeah, what do you, what do you do to sort of extract yourself from this situation?

Taako

lines: Okay you then really quickly as the boys can’t really, Merle and Taako can’t really see you anymore, you make quick work as you pull these 2 still unconscious men out of the pocket workshop and tie them up inside of the sphere. Is that-

lines: Yes...

lines: Uh okay yeah, so yeah, you get rid of your two boys and tie them up inside the bubble, and as you drop down, you hear the balloon deploy and you look up, and you can sorta see through the boughs of the trees as the sphere floats away, back up into the sky.

lines: Uh, you realise the roars are actually coming from above you, and there’s a clearing in the boughs, and you can see up, and you see that bubble, you see this sphere floating away in the balloon and you look up, and you see in the sky a HUGE beast. And it kinda flies between the sun and you, just sorta casting a shadow, and it makes it kinda hard to see, but it’s gigantic, and it’s got these two gigantic wings. And it roars as it flies directly into the balloon—

lines: [inhales sharply]— oh no!

lines: And attacks it. And the balloon pops and that sphere just falls outta the sky—

lines: My boys!

lines: —from about 80 feet up, and it falls somewhere else into the forest and uh, you hear a pretty gnarly crash, and then this huge beast kinda does a lap up in the sky, and then it comes diving down directly at the three of you.

lines: Oh no - I feel - can I just say? I feel just terrible about this.

speaker: Clint
lines: [sounding far away from his microphone and then getting closer] I feel pretty good about it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This thing comes to a sudden halt directly in front of the three of you, and you see it is in fact a gigantic beast and it has two large scaly wings, and it has a large scaly head, and it has some fire sort of spouting from the corners of its draconic mouth. But it also has two other heads. One of them is a lion, who is also roaring, and he’s got razor sharp teeth in his mouth, and the other is a goat with two large horns on its head and it’s uh bleeding at you - bleating at you violently. It is a chimera, and let’s roll some initiative.

lines: Land o’ Goshen. I rolled a 16.

lines: 12. Oh wait! I get a second roll.

lines: And it is, uhh 3d8 plus my spellcasting modifier.

speaker: Clint
lines: So that’s a 6. And my spellcasting modifier, I believe is a 3, so that makes it 9, correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes!

speaker: Justin
lines: No, well 3d8 is three of those.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay so 18 for each of us.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll it three times.

speaker: Justin
lines: You gotta roll it three times.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ohhhh. Silly Merle…

speaker: [snorts from Justin and he mutters something, probably about how his dad still doesn’t know how to play Dungeons and Dragons...]
Clint
lines: Another 6! [sound of dice rolling] And another 6!

speaker: Justin
lines: I’ll be damned! Yeez! He knew!

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, no shit! Six, six, six!

speaker: Justin
lines: It was accurate!

speaker: Clint
lines: 18 plus 3 so we each get 21 points back.

speaker: Griffin
lines: One second, wait! You said 21?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You actually only heal for 19. For some reason like… just feels a bit off, Merle.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, shit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your divine like… connection that sorta fuels all your power… It feels a bit, [high pitched] uhmmm, just feels a little bit off. Just a little bit weird. [normal voice] So that’s 19 points, still a lot, but [high pitched voice] jus’ a little bit off!

speaker: Clint
lines: [very high pitched] Well okay!

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s weird.

speaker: Clint
lines: Right! So 19 points up, correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep!

speaker: Justin
lines: Thank you very much. I needed that very much.

speaker: Clint
lines: Me too.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taako, you’re up next.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, good. Shall I kill it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure!

speaker: Travis
lines: Sure!

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, great.

speaker: Clint
lines: Awesome.

speaker: Justin
lines: Great, well, uh, I dunno if I’ll be able to kill it or not but y’know we’ll give it the ol’ college try. ‘Cause uh bad news for this uh, sonofabitch is I can cast level 6 spells now. So uh, what’s it doing right now?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I do wanna point out. You can cast level 6 spell. Cause you’ve only got the one spell slot and I told dad this while you were in the bathroom, but I am gonna be tracking that stuff unlike the… last arc—

speaker: Justin
lines: Well then, Jesus, Griffin!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s episode one, dawg, we got a lotta arc left to go!

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah but I like, you know that, our show to this point has functioned on the ‘assumed rest’. By which I mean, it is assumed that we have rested any time that the numbers don’t add up… sort of.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay.

speaker: Clint
lines: I mean, we go two weeks.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, here! Fine!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well shit’s gonna get real down in Wonderland, so I dunno about that.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, okay, here, I got this. I’ll try this one how about… aaan ice storm?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh shit.

speaker: Justin
lines: [reading from the D&D manual] “A hail of rock hard—

speaker: [He starts laughing, Travis and Clint laugh at the innuendo]
Griffin
lines: [playfully exasperated] Ohhhh, come on, really?

speaker: Travis
lines: Nooice!

speaker: Justin
lines: “40 foot high cylinders centered on a point within range” — so it’s basically just like a big-ass ice storm and you gotta succeed on a dexterity saving throw.

speaker: Travis
lines: I probably also have to succeed at that saving throw, don’t I?

speaker: Justin
lines: Uhh, are you a creature? [starts laughing]

speaker: Clint
lines: No!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah he’s a creature, I mean he, and we got to like—

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, but I got spellshaping—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You don’t got spellshaping anymore. I cannot stress this enough. You gave that up when you switched to transmutation.

speaker: Justin
lines: I never sw-, I wouldn’t say ‘switched’. Okay. Alright well, I don’t spellshape anymore.

speaker: Clint
lines: He’s turned into a hardass!

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I love it, though.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [loudly, nearly over Justin’s comment] Uh 13… doesn’t do it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Noooo.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus, how’d you do?

speaker: Justin
lines: Trav?

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it dexterity?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh so it’s 14 plus 2, 16.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, yes, that does succeed.

speaker: Travis
lines: Perfect.

speaker: Justin
lines: 15 is what we were looking for.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right. Uh so, what do I do?

speaker: Justin
lines: You’re going to take 2d8 bludgeoning damage, and 4d6 cold damage.

speaker: Clint
lines: Man!

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right.

speaker: Justin
lines: So lemme do the cold damage first—

speaker: Travis
lines: Really glad I dodged!

speaker: Justin
lines: Me tooooo. [sound of rolling dice] 4. [clattering dice] 6. [clattering dice] 6. [clattering dice] 4. Wow. Devastating.

speaker: Justin
lines: 20 cold damage. And then lemme grab that d8 right quick.

speaker: Clint
lines: [in a golf commentator’s hushed voice] Justin is reaching for the metallic bag within which he keeps his die. Let’s see what happens!

speaker: Justin
lines: [muttering] I’ll do a good job, that’s what happens. Every time. [rolls dice] 6.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jesus!

speaker: Justin
lines: [rolls dice] And 4. So 10—

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, 30 altogether.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That was a big hit. With that hit, the dragon head looks pretty bad off—

speaker: Justin
lines: Now Magnus, my dude, you do have to take that half that damage, and I am very, very sorry about that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh no!

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s fine. That’s fine, you know what? I get it.

speaker: Justin
lines: I think it’s what you would’ve wanted.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So that’s 15 damage to you, Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, down to 96...

speaker: Clint
lines: The Merle giveth and the Taako taketh away.

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean, listen, I’m still at 96 hitpoints, so I’m doing o-kay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Geez!

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, I’m a tank!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The dragon head looks pretty bad off after that hit, the other two heads look uh… pretty hurt, but not as bad off as the dragon head, cause the dragon head - the chimera’s up next - the dragon head tries to barf up a spout of flame but nothing really comes out, uh so instead it is going to snap at you, Magnus, since you goaded it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Good luck!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, 19 versus AC?

speaker: Travis
lines: What if I’m at 19?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, no, on attack rolls the attacker hits.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, okay. Well then, I got hit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Uh, he bites into you for 13 points of damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s fine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The ram’s head is going to charge at you, Magnus. Well it’s not a ram—charging, it’s like, just standing still tryin’ta butt ya.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, that’s just 15 though, so that’s a miss.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then the lion head is gonna take disadvantage and try to attack Merle.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, that was a 19 versus AC, which I imagine hits but…?

speaker: Clint
lines: It hits.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh 17 versus AC?

speaker: Clint
lines: No! My AC is 18.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! Uh it gets like it’s mouth on you, but its teeth do not get through your armour. And it retracts. Next up is Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: Because I want the extra AC I’m now gonna switch to one-handed Railsplitter and get my shield out.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay!

speaker: Travis
lines: That’ll give me a plus 2 to AC. Then I’m going toooooo… I’mma try to get on its back.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh okay, we’re Dragon’s Dogma-ing this shit now, then?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah yeah. What would that be? Is that acrobatics or athletics?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhm it’s gonna try to buck you off, so I think it’s gonna be for you probably athletics versus my… dexterity? Uh yeah, probably dexterity.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well I rolled a 21.

speaker: Travis
lines: I got 16 plus 7, so 23.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Yeah, you’re on this thing’s back and you’re grabbed on.

speaker: Travis
lines: I guess that’s probably one of my actions, right? Or is that the move?

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is... We’ll say that is… I mean, that’s one of your actions, yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, and then I will attack the base of the dragon neck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, we’ll say you have advantage since you kinda have a good position on it now.

speaker: Travis
lines: Kay, good because that was a 1. [laughs and rolls again] Okay so 15 plus 7, 22, 23.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yup, that is a hit.

speaker: Travis
lines: 8 plus 6, 14 points of damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay the dragon head looks like, unconscious? now. The dragon head is just kinda hanging limp.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, that’s it, right? ‘Cause you did 2 actions.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, uh Merle, you are up.

speaker: Clint
lines: I am going to cast… a brand new one!

speaker: Justin
lines: Mmm!

speaker: Clint
lines: Insect Plague!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Holy shit! Okay! Okay! Yes!

speaker: Clint
lines: [reading aloud from the D&D manual] “Swarming biting locusts fill a 20 foot radius sphere centered on a point—”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Excellent.

speaker: Clint
lines: “—that you choose within range. A creature takes 4d10 piercing damage” but it has to make a constitution saving throw.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Kay—

speaker: Travis
lines: Ohh, you guys!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You just gonna aim that right at Magnus? Or you just sorta gonna put that one—

speaker: Clint
lines: No! I’m gonna aim the sphere at the feet of the chimera.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t think that dog’s gonna hunt. ‘Cause that would mean that you’re aiming it into the ground. The conceit for area-effect attacks is that they have collateral damage and the only way to abate that is to... plan around it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, I hit him with the sphere!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay!

speaker: Clint
lines: You got 96 points, right, Magnus?

speaker: Justin
lines: He’s fiiiine!

speaker: Travis
lines: Sure! What do I—

speaker: Justin
lines: We’re just here with all the points you had!

speaker: Travis
lines: What is it—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Constitution.

speaker: Travis
lines: Constitution, you say?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, close to 20.

speaker: Justin
lines: Whaddup! What’s up now!

speaker: Clint
lines: [cheering] Yeah!

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s a crit twentyyyyy! The bugs! Swarm! Around meeeee!

speaker: Justin
lines: You’re dodgin’ ‘em like fuckin Neo.

speaker: Clint
lines: All right! So I need to roll 4— 4d10.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well no, I rolled a 19. I think this thing saves, but it has to move, right? Or else…?

speaker: Clint
lines: [reading from the manual] “Creature takes 4d10 piercing damage on a failed save,”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right.

speaker: Clint
lines: “or half as much damage on a successful one.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay so there’s the half damage. So you still roll damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, cool!

speaker: Clint
lines: [sound of clattering dice] Wait, is that the 10? All right 7. [sound of clattering dice] 5. [sound of clattering dice] Zero - oh that’s 10!

speaker: Justin
lines: 10, yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: So what’s that up to so far?

speaker: Clint
lines: 7, 22. [sound of clattering dice] 19!

speaker: Travis
lines: Wow!

speaker: Clint
lines: A nine, 21!

speaker: Griffin
lines: But half that, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, half of 31.

speaker: Clint
lines: 31. So fifteen and a half points.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, just 15.

speaker: Travis
lines: [pleading playfully] Even though I crit-ed, Griffin?

speaker: Clint
lines: [overlapping] Awww.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you round up to 16.

speaker: Travis
lines: [overlapping] No wait, now hold on—!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, even though you crit-ed.

speaker: Travis
lines: Ugh, okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: [holding back laughter] That seems unlikely. [giggling]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhm... as it takes that—

speaker: Justin
lines: He was so constitute though.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —it takes that damage and the lion head, now droops down, uh, and is unconscious. and with that, the goat head like bleats loudly and it rears back on its back legs and Magnus, you, you, uh, Magnus I guess make a dex save.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, I mean, meh. It’s an 8.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah, you get thrown off its back to the ground, but you don’t take any damage. And the uh goat head, the only sort of remaining head and the rest of its body extends those wings, and it starts to flap them to fly off. And it gets a few feet off the ground, and then an arrow comes in and hits that goat head right in the dome. And with that, uh, the chimera just instantly falls to the ground, dead. And when you look behind you—

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh please be Hawkeye, please be Hawkeye!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s the, it’s the Guy himself. The Hawk… Guy!

speaker: Clint
lines: Hawkeye?! [sighs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see a few people. You see a half-elf, uh, man, who is kinda gruff, and dressed mostly in pelts. And he’s holding this bigass longbow, in like attack position, so he was the one who shot that arrow. He’s got a short, shaggy beard and dark red hair. With him you see a wood elf who has dark purple hair and nearly identical leather armour to the half-elf with the bow. And she’s holding this knotted, natural wooden staff. And uh, these two are standing in like, combat poses. And from out behind a tree, sort of cautiously poking his head outward, you see a kinda scrawny human man, who is no older than like 20 years old, probably, but he’s dressed in like this finery that is white and gold. He is the cleanest thing in a 10 mile radius.

speaker: Is there a roll, is there a skill that would like, let you know who people are? Like in 4th edition, there was ‘streetwise’. Is there anything like that in this game? What would you roll to like, know who…?
Travis
lines: History…?

speaker: Justin
lines: History or insight?

speaker: Clint
lines: I have Legend Lore. A spell...

speaker: Travis
lines: Insight, I would say.

speaker: Clint
lines: If I describe a person it— if I describe a person—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh no, insight is— make a… how about just make a straight-up Intelligence roll?

speaker: Travis
lines: [glumly] Oh. [sound of rolling dice] I got an 18!

speaker: Clint
lines: I got a natural 4.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus and Taako, you recognise this guy. He is Lord Artemis Sterling. The Ruler of Neverwinter, and the most powerful man in the world.

speaker: Clint
lines: But I get the credit on the kill, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, def.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.
